intro: Tofieldia glutinosa var. intermedia, commonly known as the sticky tofieldia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and showy, spike-like inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The sticky, resinous substance on its stems and leaves is a distinguishing feature of this variety.
